tweets.content:
We're bringing NASA+ to 
@Netflix
!

Starting this summer, Netflix audiences will be able to stream rocket launches, spacewalks, and other major live events on the platform. Read more about how we're working to bring NASA's work to a global audience: https://go.nasa.gov/40wCJdY

This cosmic duo helped scientists to understand pulsars better.

Pulsars are the mysterious remnants of certain stars that evolve and behave in ways that aren’t totally understood. But this pulsar system, J1023, acted as the perfect test subject: https://go.nasa.gov/4kGVBhG

To celebrate three years of studying the universe, 
@NASAWebb
 has clawed back the thick, dusty layers of the Cat's Paw Nebula. 

With its infrared vision, Webb can peer through clouds of gas and dust to uncover what lies beneath: https://go.nasa.gov/467QoMt

combined_text: We're bringing NASA+ to Netflix ! Starting this summer, Netflix audiences will be able to stream rocket launches, spacewalks, and other major live events on the platform. Read more about how we're working to bring NASA's work to a global audience: This cosmic duo helped scientists to understand pulsars better. Pulsars are the mysterious remnants of certain stars that evolve and behave in ways that aren’t totally understood. But this pulsar system, J1023, acted as the perfect test subject: To celebrate three years of studying the universe, NASAWebb has clawed back the thick, dusty layers of the Cat's Paw Nebula. With its infrared vision, Webb can peer through clouds of gas and dust to uncover what lies beneath: Fifty years ago today, an Apollo spacecraft launched into space and days later, docked with a Soyuz spacecraft for the first time. NASA astronaut Thomas Stafford and cosmonaut Alexei Leonov shook hands in space on July 17 and paved the way for future cooperation on the space
summary: We're bringing NASA's work to a global audience by streaming rockets launches, spacewalks, and other major live events on Netflix. The Cosmic Duo helped scientists to understand pulsars better. NASA astronaut Thomas Stafford and cosmonaut Alexei Leonov shook hands in space on July 17th and paved the way for future cooperation on the space.
